I scream

similaranime.anime: Yahari Ore no Seishun LoveCome wa Machigatte Iru. Zoku
Sakurako-san no Ashimoto ni wa Shitai ga Umatte Iru
Yahari Ore no Seishun LoveCome wa Machigatte Iru.
Haruchika: Haruta to Chika wa Seishun Suru

recommendations.recommendation: I like this show a lot; great animation and a pace that supports rich character development. I recommend it without reservation

In short it`s slice of life about youngsters who play as some detective and solve ferial misteries. The animation is pretty good, but nothing else outstanding. Slow, realistic, harmless detective juvenile fiction with mild fanservice. The pace of the story can be found slow and some characters are overacted, so it can be boring or annoying for some people.

Like the main stories are good, but some of the sub story (sorta filler) have little to know "content" to it, making me feel if it was necessary. Definitely not for people who are looking for some deep mystery, more like daily life mystery.
A slice of life/detective combination which works out well despite the odd combination. Recommended for SoL fans who like a little bit of plot in the show.

As much as the characters are flesh out and the directing is good enough, there isn`t much going on, is fine as far slice of life goes but it can be pretty boring if you are hoping for anything at all

First of all this show is not going to get 100% praise from me but, The animation is beautiful. The story is paced slowly to set the mood for the show. Some viewers may not like it but for once I actually like how this show is paced. My only issue with the show is I personally cannot stand the lead character. I expect alot from this show as it progresses.

It has great characterization, very good character development, and an excellent, subtle and realistic approach to and portrayal of its themes: from youth, growing up - as well as the adolescent troubles that entails - to learning how to enjoy things you`d usually take for granted, or finding your place in the "world".
Everything is lead forward by really well done character interaction and a relatively fresh take on an old genre (mystery and puzzle solving), and everything is held together wonderfully by the great visual presentation (complete with great use of restrained artistic licence and low-key visual symbolism), animation, soundtrack and voice acting.
I`d say it`s the best that 2012 had to offer as far as anime series go.

Rating 9/10 : A series that holds a decent grasp on the mystery genre, it`s enough to get you into it, but not to much to overload your senses. The main character is the epitome of sloth, and i love it, If your into slice of life with abit of mystery and romance this is a great look.

Hyouka is defiantly one hell of an anime. I wasn`t so sure about it at the beginning but this anime- believe it or not- got much better toward the 2nd half! loved the cases they had to solve some were good some were just silly :P over all this is a good anime that worth you time.. give it a try
Excellent character study with cinematographic cred for days. Some small mysteries, but primarily an exploration of its four main characters.
why is everybody afraid of love? O_o great anime with loveble characters and good story.
a very decent show to watch really nice visuals and a peaceful plot

Pacing is slow but appropriate given the material and situations. Characters begin to flesh out a little deeper into the story as they begin to experience the trials of adolescence. So far the series has been unforgettable and I highly recommend to anime fans. (This is my first anime series since Nisemonogatari. Looks like the industry`s still got some juice left, albeit working at a much slower rate.
Get`s better as you start to feel, that it`s not about the mysteries.

A welcome change from a seemingly unending torrent of moeblob harem anime. A slow but steady pacing, interesting story and likeable characters all combine together to make this an enjoyable series. I think this will probably become one of my favourites from the past couple of years and definitely one I`ll watch again in the future.
this show is great! i hope season 2 will come.. :)

Hum... it`s pretty good... great start and good development, very well writen and greatly executed. The only problem is the lacking of "Objective" you don`t truly see any "point". I know these types are like this, but there is just something missing when you get at the end.
This show is wonderful!

First of all, really good animation quality... one of the best of 2012. On the first glance this show is just like another daily life or slice of life anime, there are no objective and kind of slow paced, but with all the logic and case solving involved this show becomes very amusing to watch. Usually anime like this gives "just enjoy the show" feeling but i find myself keep wanting more, cant wait for more and suddenly the show end, you know that kind of feeling when watching great show.
Skillfully animated detective stories. For the amateurs of slice of life-types animes.

Were it just for the quality of the animation, Hyouka is a must-see. But they give us more than visual excellence, because this series is a gentle interlacing of mystery and school life, and the little romance which subdues the action is lovely (and secondary, this is not a romance-focused anime)... The mysteries which are solved come from very simple facts and logical deductions, but are developed in a way that keeps you really interested. In my opinion, the best anime of Summer 2012, maybe of the year.
One of the best anime of the last years. Excellent animation, original plot, wonderful character design, and everything perfectly blended together. Absolutely a must see.
it`s just awesome....must see 4 everyone

The animation, soundtrack, voice acting and artwork are all a notch or two above the usual quality. An engaging story told with flair and a good amount of subtext rounds this out into a must-see show.
Perfect. I just love the background music, the plot, the characters. Go and look at Hyouka. That is order!
I don`t want to say anything about it to ruin it so.. Just watch it it`s good. If nothing else see it for the animation.. It has solid op/ed`s as well.

Amazing, I can`t really think anything else to say about Hyouka. It`s just ridiculous how good this show is.
Must see for sure.

it has a slow and steady pace but surely has it`s own "bite" to it. (i`m not much of a lover of this genre but i got hooked in it). you still judge what you can say about it but it is definitely one of the must watch anime of 2012.
The best anime this season for me. Hyouka is an all rounder: great animation with good story and lovable characters. It`s a perfect mix of slice of life, romance, and light detective series

Well, Hyouka`s finally over. And what a show it`s been, with great characters and a fantastic soundtrack. It`s a show you`ll love, no matter what genre you watch. I`ll miss my weekly Hyouka (and my well deserved moe) more than anything :(
Great Anime, slice of life with a hint of romance and mystery, Characters are great and memorable

It`s hard to describe how much I enjoyed this series. It felt very refreshing. Relaxing atmosphere filled with detective stories mixed with lovable characters and fantastic visuals/animation. Let`s just simply say I loved it.
those people,interested in detective type anime, mystery,etc type must watch it!!

One of the best school romance anime I have ever seen, even though the first 6 episodes you may find a bit boring. But overall, it gives us a very logical story. If you are looking for some type of animes with mysterious and romance inside. This one you definitely need to check it out. It`s probably one of the best work done by Kyoani .

`tis the kind of anime without any major back-story. It doesn`t divulge the characters stories either. It just puts you in there, just as if you meet a group of exciting people one day and join their group. `tis that kind of feeling....
Oh and the OST is probably the best for this season...

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch40519 [Houtarou] is not assertive about getting involved with anything, but was ordered by his older sister, http://anidb.net/ch41032 [Tomoe], to join the http://anidb.net/ch46919 [Classic Literature Club]. In the club, he gets close to the truth about an incident, involving a female member`s uncle, that happened 45 years ago. The energy-saving boy is joined by the inquisitive girl http://anidb.net/ch40518 [Chitanda Eru] in this mystery... Source: ANN Note: The first episode received an early screening at a special event held at Kadokawa Cinema Shinjuku on 14.04.2012. The regular TV broadcast started on 23.04.2012.

tag.name: detective
tag.description: A detective is an investigator, generally either a member of a law enforcement agency or as an individual working in the capacity of private investigators, tasked with solving crimes and other mysteries, such as disappearances, by examining and evaluating clues and records in order to solve the mystery; for a crime, this would mean uncovering the criminal`s identity and/or whereabouts. In some police systems, a detective position is achieved by passing a written test after a person completes the requirements for being a police officer; in others, detectives are college graduates who join directly from civilian life without first serving as uniformed officers. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: bishoujo
tag.description: In Japanese, a bishoujo is any pretty female from toddlerhood to late adolescence. In the West, the word specifically refers to attractive girls generally from late childhood or early adolescence, especially those that appeal to males, and particularly to fictional characters designed in a way traditionally associated to shoujo manga. Fictional bishoujo tend to be cute, pastel-coloured teenagers; they lack the sophistication of older women, instead having detailed eye and hair design, fluttery costumes often including ribbons, and all sorts of generally sparkly fluff.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: Newtype Anime Award
tag.description: This anime has won 1 or more Newtype Anime Award(s)

tag.name: literature
tag.description: Works of literature are featured. Likely, a prominent character in this anime likes to read books, or the books themselves play a role. They might be specific, named works of literature or books in general.

tag.name: remastered version available
tag.description: This anime has been remastered in a higher quality format than the original release. The remaster may be a simple upscale, or it could be a full enhancement project from the original frames. This is irrespective of whether specific groups have released rips of such formats to the internet.

tag.name: character driven
tag.description: The main appeal of the show is the way the characters are portrayed and interact, focusing on dialogue, spending time together or getting to know each other. These anime are not "story-less" but story is secondary to character development and the characters themselves and what they experience.

tag.name: OP and ED sung by characters
tag.description: OP and/or ED in this anime is sung by the characters and animation shows them singing.

tag.name: walls of text
tag.description: Walls of text refers to Japanese text that appears in large quantities within the anime itself. This text is most likely vital to the storyline and may come in the form of charts and diagrams or pieces of paper, notes or even thoughts that are only partially or entirely unspoken. May also be taken as a fair warning to viewers unable to translate Japanese text on their own, suggesting that thorough subtitle support may be required as well as making use of the pause button on their media players so that all text can be read. Normally, tags don`t refer to physical translations of text, subtitle appearances and karaoke styling added by 3rd parties. But those who seek to describe an anime that is heavy on SPOKEN dialogue (which may tend to create a large quantity of natural subtitling to read for those not fluent in the language being used) could consider this tag but may make clearer reference with the dialogue driven tag.

tag.name: Sherlock Holmes
tag.description: Fictional London-based detective created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

tag.name: mystery
tag.description: The mystery film is a sub-genre of the more general category of crime film. It focuses on the efforts of the detective, private investigator or amateur sleuth to solve the mysterious circumstances of a crime by means of clues, investigation, and clever deduction. (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tales
tag.description: Tales are stories told time and again and passed down from generation to generation, and some of those show up in anime not just once or twice, but several times.

tag.name: adapted into Japanese movie
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a Japanese movie. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Ibara Mayaka
character.description: The fourth member of the Classic Literature Club; she joined after the other three. She and the boys attended the same middle school. She doesn`t get along well with Houtarou though their relationship starts to improve after she befriends Eru. Mayaka has a passion for drawing manga and is also a member of the school`s manga club, though she is extremely reluctant about expressing it. Mayaka has long harbored romantic feelings towards Satoshi, who has always treated her in a frivolous way. She later begins to date Satoshi. She refers to Satoshi as Fuku-chan. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Chitanda Eru
character.description: An inquisitive girl who joins the Classic Literature Club. Eru`s catchphrase is "I`m curious!" ("わたし, 気になります", watashi, ki ni narimasu!). Although she earns top grades in academics, she is often ditzy and relies on Oreki`s reasoning abilities often. She is an energetic girl that is well-versed in the town traditions and etiquette, having come from a lineage of wealthy farmers. Whenever a mystery is brought to her, she won`t be able to stop thinking about it until it is solved. She holds great admiration for Oreki, often praising him for his talent in solving mysteries. It is hinted that she harbors feelings for Oreki. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Oreki Houtarou
character.description: The main protagonist of Hyouka, he is a rational boy who lives by "If I don`t have to do something, I won`t, but if I have to, I`ll do it quickly." He only joins the Classic Literature Club at the request of his older sister, Oreki Tomoe, to stop it from being dissolved. He says that he doesn`t like to waste energy, but if given a mystery to consider, he will see it through until it is solved with his brilliantly logical deductions. To him, Eru is "someone he can`t ignore," hinting that he may have feelings for her. At her urging, he soon finds himself more involved with high school life. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Fukube Satoshi
character.description: Houtarou`s classmate who joins the Classic Literature Club with him. He is proud of his impressive memory, referring to himself as a human "database", and wears a perpetual grin. Although he always urges Oreki to participate more in life, it is revealed that he is also secretly jealous of Oreki for his critical reasoning abilities. He calls Ibara Mayaka by her first name, which indicates the two are close. Later on, Satoshi reveals that he does have feelings for Mayaka, but doesn`t want to become "obsessed" with her. He begins to date Mayaka in the spring of their second year. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 栄光ある古典部の昔日
绽放荣光的古籍研究社之过往
The Classic Lit Club`s Glorious Days of Yore
Eikou Aru Koten Bu no Sekijitsu
episode.summary: Eru decides to solicit Satoshi and Mayaka`s help hypothesizing what happened to her uncle. The club members meet at the Chitanda estate, where they present their research and surmise what they believe happened 45 years ago. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 事情ある古典部の末裔
另有隐情的古籍研究社之后裔
The Circumstances of the Classic Lit Club`s Scion
Jijou Aru Koten Bu no Matsuei
episode.summary: Over coffee, Eru opens up to Oreki to explain why she joined the club, and asks him for his help with a personal matter. Still unable to locate any anthologies, the club members run into an obstacle when trying to search the club`s previous room. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 名誉ある古典部の活動
值得夸耀的古籍研究社之活动
The Prestigious Classic Lit Club`s Activities
Meiyo Aru Koten Bu no Katsudou
episode.summary: Eru grows bored of the club`s lack of activities, and suggests that they prepare an anthology to submit for the school`s culture festival in the fall. While tracking down previous anthologies, the club discovers a mystery in the school`s library. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝統ある古典部の再生
深具传统的古籍研究社之重生
The Return of the Time-Honored Classic Lit Club
Dentou Aru Koten Bu no Saisei
episode.summary: "Energy conservationist" Hotaro Oreki joins the Classic Lit Club at his high school at his sister`s behest, to keep it from being shut down. Also joining the club are his best friend, Satoshi Fukube, and Eru Chitanda, a curious girl who enjoys mysteries. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大罪を犯す
犯下大罪
Committing a Cardinal Sin
Daizai o Okasu
episode.summary: Hotaro`s history class is interrupted by an outburst coming from Eru`s math class, prompting a discussion in the Classic Lit Club about the nature of the seven deadly sins, and what might provoke Eru to become angry. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 歴史ある古典部の真実
走过历史的古籍研究社之真相
The Truth About the Historic Classic Lit Club
Rekishi Aru Koten Bu no Shinjitsu
episode.summary: Hotaro is torn between continuing with his "gray" life and the "rosy" life that the others live. A phone call from Hotaro`s sister leads him to believe that there are pieces missing to his theory regarding the events of Sekitani`s expulsion. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 試写会に行こう!
参加试映会!
Let`s Go to the Screening!
Shisha Kai ni Ikou!
episode.summary: One of Eru`s acquaintances invites the Classic Lit Club to a screening of a student film made by the members of Class 2-F so they can offer their opinions. When the movie takes an unexpected turn, the club is called on to help find a solution. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 正体見たり
发现真面目
Upon Seeing the True Nature
Shoutai Mitari
episode.summary: During summer vacation, the Classic Lit Club members take a trip into the mountains to stay at a hot springs resort inn run by Mayaka`s relatives. While there, Eru and Mayaka see what appears to be the ghost of a man who hanged himself! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 古丘廃村殺人事件
古丘废村凶杀案
The Case of the Furuoka Deserted Village Murder
Furuoka Haison Satsujin Jiken
episode.summary: In search of a conclusion to their movie, the assistant director, the prop master, and the publicist meet with the Classic Lit Club members one at a time to propose their solutions to the unfinished murder mystery. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 愚者のエンドロール
愚者的片尾
Credit Roll of Fools
Gusha no Endroll
episode.summary: When the others ask Hotaro about his solution to the murder mystery, he begins to have doubts about it himself. Hotaro confronts Irisu regarding the reason why she called the Classic Lit Club in to help finish the film. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 万人の死角
万人的死角
Blind Spot to All
Bannin no Shikaku
episode.summary: After meeting with Irisu, Hotaro has a change of heart, and sets his mind to solving the murder mystery. Hotaro and Satoshi discuss the nature of their own potential, and what each of them might be able to accomplish. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 限りなく積まれた例のあれ
如那样不断累积
Those Things Piled Up Endlessly
Kagirinaku Tsumareta Rei no Are
episode.summary: It is the first day of the school culture festival, and the club members look forward to it with both longing and dread. They must come up with a way to sell all of the copies of "Hyouka" that were printed, as dauntless as the task seems. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ワイルド・ファイア
疯狂火焰
Wild Fire
Wildfire
episode.summary: The Classic Lit Club cooking team competes against three other teams in the Cooking Club`s timed "Wild Fire" competition. However, Mayaka is delayed drawing posters for the Manga Club. Will she be able to finish in time to compete? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夕べには骸に
昨晚的遗骸
A Corpse by Evening
Yuube ni wa Mukuro ni
episode.summary: Satoshi tries to use the Quiz Club`s quiz show event to promote the Classic Lit Club. Eru goes around beating the bushes for ways to help sell all of the copies of "Hyouka." More and more items end up missing from various clubs. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クドリャフカの順番
库特利亚芙卡的排序
The Kudryavka Sequence
Kudryavka no Junban
episode.summary: Eru appears on a school radio show, asking all the other students to stand with the Classic Lit Club against the phantom thief. Hotaro confronts the person he believes to be Jumoji. Satoshi comes to terms with his expectations. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最後の標的
最后的目标
The Final Target
Saigo no Hyouteki
episode.summary: Satoshi is ready for Jumoji to strike, but when the anticipated target is passed over, he must reconsider his strategy. Tomoe gives Hotaro a copy of "A Corpse By Evening," and Eru notices that the art style is similar to one she has seen elsewhere. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 十文字事件
十文字事件
The Jumonji Affair
Juumonji Jiken
episode.summary: Eru`s curiosity is drawn by the rash of thefts from the various clubs, and when Hotaro discovers a pattern to the crimes, Satoshi comes up with a way to publicize the Classic Lit Club through the school newspaper so they can sell their anthologies. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あきましておめでとう
"开"年快乐
Mishap-py New Year
Akimashite Ometedou
episode.summary: At New Year`s, Eru invites Hotaro to join her in paying her family`s respects at the town shrine. When Eru agrees to run a quick errand, however, she and Hotaro find themselves in an unexpected and compromising situation. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 心あたりのある者は
心中有数的人
Does Anyone Have Any Idea?
Kokoro Atari no Aru Mono wa
episode.summary: Hotaro tells Eru that he can come up with a plausible explanation for any situation she can think of, so when a seemingly mundane schoolwide announcement is made, she challenges him to figure out the reason behind the announcement. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 連峰は晴れているか
峰峦是否晴天
Is the Mountain Range Clear?
Renpou wa Hareteiru ka?
episode.summary: While chatting in the club room after school, Hotaro remembers how one of his teachers in middle school famously liked helicopters. But when the others dispute the characterization, Hotaro wonders if there is something more to it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遠まわりする雛
The Doll That Took the Long Way Around
Toomawari Suru Hina
episode.summary: Hotaro is enlisted by Eru to appear in a Dolls` Festival parade that her local shrine holds every year. When construction work unexpectedly causes a last-minute detour, it leaves the participants wondering what went awry. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 手作りチョコレート事件
手制巧克力事件
The Case of the Homemade Chocolates
Tezukuri Chocolate Jiken
episode.summary: While in middle school, Satoshi rejected Mayaka`s Valentine chocolate, so this year, she works even harder to present him with a Valentine`s Day masterpiece. But when it turns up missing, the search is on to discover what happened to it. Source: crunchyroll
